title: Santa Clara County MEHKO
description: Home-based restaurant permit for up to 30 meals/day or 90 meals/week, max $100,000 annual sales. No signage; food must be prepared, cooked, and served/delivered the same day.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
**What to do:** Confirm you can run a MEHKO at home and understand core limits.

**Why it matters:** You must operate within MEHKO rules to be approved and stay compliant.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Residence in Santa Clara County
- ☐ Menu and daily/weekly production plan (≤30/day, ≤90/week)
- ☐ Kitchen setup meeting food safety practices

**Where/how:** Review Santa Clara County’s MEHKO overview page and FAQ.

**Time estimate:** 

**Ready when:** You can state your daily/weekly meal volume and that it fits MEHKO limits.
searchTerms: Santa Clara MEHKO daily meal limits
Santa Clara Home Kitchen Operations rules

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get your Certified Food Protection Manager (CFPM) credential and any needed property approvals.

**Why it matters:** Food safety certification is required and property rules may apply.

**What you need:**
- ☐ CFPM certificate (ANSI-CFP recognized)
- ☐ Landlord/HOA OK if applicable
- ☐ City business license if required

**Where/how:** Take an ANSI-approved CFPM course; check local business license rules.

**Time estimate:** ~

**Ready when:** You have a CFPM certificate and any property/business approvals.
searchTerms: ANSI-CFP Food Protection Manager Santa Clara
Santa Clara business license home food operation

steps.title: Prepare Required Documents
steps.content:
**What to do:** Gather the documents you'll submit with your application.

**Why it matters:** Incomplete submissions delay approval and inspection.

**What you need:**
- ☐ SOP form — go to Step 4: MEHKO Application Packet
- ☐ Health Permit Application — go to Step 4: MEHKO Application Packet
- ☐ CFPM certificate (from Step 2: Approvals & Training)
- ☐ Government ID and utility bill (for residency proof)
- ☐ Floor plan of kitchen and food prep area

**Where/how:** Collect all required documents before submitting.

**Time estimate:** 

**Ready when:** All documents are filled/signed and stored as PDFs.
searchTerms: Santa Clara Home Kitchen Operations forms

steps.title: MEHKO Application Packet (includes SOP + Permit Application)
steps.content:
**What to do:** Download and complete the single MEHKO Application Packet. It includes the **Permit Application**, **Self‑Certification Checklist**, and **SOP**.

**Why it matters:** Santa Clara uses one combined packet; no separate SOP/permit PDFs needed.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Owner/site details & contact info
- ☐ Menu + food safety/SOP details
- ☐ Proof of water & sewage (see packet)
- ☐ CFPM certificate (or submit within 60 days as allowed)

**Where/how:** Fill all packet sections, save as a single PDF.

**Ready when:** Entire packet is complete and internally consistent.
searchTerms: Santa Clara MEHKO SOP and permit combined PDF

steps.title: Submit Application & Fees
steps.content:
**What to do:** Submit the completed packet and pay required fees.

**Why it matters:** The county processes your permit after submission and payment.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Completed Application — go to Step 4: MEHKO Application Packet
- ☐ Completed SOP — go to Step 4: MEHKO Application Packet
- ☐ CFPM certificate
- ☐ Proof of residence
- ☐ Payment method

**Where/how:** Submit by email to dehweb@deh.sccgov.org, by mail to 1555 Berger Drive, Suite 300, San Jose, CA 95112, or in person at the DEH office. Pay online or by check/money order as directed.

**Time estimate:** Initial permit 

**Ready when:** County confirms receipt and payment.
searchTerms: Santa Clara Environmental Health submission MEHKO

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
**What to do:** Coordinate a home kitchen inspection with Environmental Health.

**Why it matters:** Passing inspection is required before operating.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Kitchen ready per your SOP
- ☐ Thermometer, sanitizer, handwash setup
- ☐ All required equipment functional

**Where/how:** The department will contact you to schedule an inspection after your application is approved.

**Time estimate:** Included in permit fee · ~1–2 hours on site

**Ready when:** You receive a pass and any corrections are resolved.
searchTerms: Santa Clara Home Kitchen inspection preparation
Santa Clara Environmental Health inspection MEHKO

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get your MEHKO permit after passing inspection and keep it on hand.

**Why it matters:** You must have a valid permit to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Final approval notice
- ☐ Permit document

**Where/how:** Issued by Environmental Health after inspection approval.

**Time estimate:** 

**Ready when:** You have the permit and any conditions noted by the inspector.
searchTerms: Santa Clara Environmental Health permit status

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
**What to do:** Follow your SOP and MEHKO limits; renew as required.

**Why it matters:** Staying within rules protects customers and your permit status.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Daily/weekly meal logs under limits
- ☐ Temperature & cleaning records
- ☐ Permit renewal reminder

**Where/how:** Keep simple records; contact DEH if your menu or volume changes.

**Time estimate:** Renewal 

**Ready when:** You track meals, keep records, and renew on time.
searchTerms: Santa Clara MEHKO meal tracking requirements

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
**What to do:** Use the contact information below for questions and assistance.

**Why it matters:** County staff can help with specific questions about your application.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Phone or email for questions
- ☐ Office address and hours
- ☐ Website for additional resources

**Where/how:** Department of Environmental Health (DEH) — Phone: (408) 918-3400 · Email: dehweb@deh.sccgov.org · Office: 1555 Berger Drive, Suite 300, San Jose, CA 95112. Hours: Mon–Fri 8AM–5PM.

**Time estimate:** 

**Ready when:** You have the information you need to proceed.
